Question: Object-Oriented Programming means ...
Answer1: Being objective about what you develop
Answer2: Designing the application based on the objects discovered when analysing the problem
Answer3: Writing an algorithm before writing your program and having a test plan
Correct_Answer: Writing a program composed of Java classes

Question: If none of the private/protected/public is specified for a member, that member ...
Answer2: Is only accessible by other classes of the same package
Answer3: Is only accessible from within the class
Correct_Answer: Is accessible by the class and its subclasses
